news_header: The Serious Fraud Office is investigating a hotel and conference centre project by Unite the Union, which has resulted in significant financial losses and missing funds.
news_text: The Serious Fraud Office (SFO) is investigating a hotel and conference centre project in Birmingham, funded by Unite the Union, which spent £112 million of its members' money. The project is now valued at only £29 million, indicating a loss of £83 million. An inquiry led by a KC has uncovered a missing £14 million, raising concerns about financial misconduct. Unite's general secretary, Sharon Graham, is committed to uncovering any wrongdoing. The project, completed in 2020, was intended to be a cost-saving investment for the union. Previous general secretary Len McCluskey supported the project, but the union's executive council feels misled about its value. The investigation follows a separate inquiry into bribery and fraud involving South Wales Police. Unite has stated that Graham faces significant opposition but remains determined to seek the truth and recover lost funds.
